results.headline: Behind Bars, Where Anything Goes
results.summary_short: A brutal off-the-grid prison leads Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone to try to break out in “Escape Plan.”

results.headline: Ah, Berlin, Home to Concerts With Phalluses
results.summary_short: The stage show in “Peaches Does Herself” reflects the vagina-inspired art of its title figure, who is also the director.

results.headline: Jaded, Maybe, but Not Ready for Vegas
results.summary_short: “Paradise,” written and directed by Diablo Cody, focuses on a young plane crash victim who decides to find her wild side in Las Vegas.

results.headline: A Schizophrenic’s 15-Minute Fame
results.summary_short: A gallery owner and a disturbed artist work together in the Los Angeles documentary “Mondays With William.”

results.headline: An American Adrift in Hong Kong
results.summary_short: In “Lost for Words,” a lonely American man meets a wistful Chinese woman before coming face to face with oppression.

results.display_title: I'm in Love With a Church Girl
results.headline: A Promoter Finds a New Cause: God
results.summary_short: The rapper Ja Rule stars as a stylish concert publicist in “I’m in Love With a Church Girl,” written by a pastor who plays a pastor in the film.

results.headline: Chopping, Flipping and Feinting in Search of Lost Art
results.summary_short: Jackie Chan revisits a quest for totemic animals in “Chinese Zodiac.”

results.headline: Sinning a Little to Defeat the Demons
results.summary_short: Debauched exorcists on a suicide mission practice their craft in “Hellbenders,” a comedy from J. T. Petty.

results.headline: A Day in the Life of a Ghost
results.summary_short: “Haunter,” directed by Vincenzo Natali and starring Abigail Breslin, mixes elements of “Groundhog Day” with “Poltergeist.”

results.headline: A Boundless Appetite for a Universe of Sound
results.summary_short: “Enzo Avitabile Music Life,” directed by Jonathan Demme, follows this Neapolitan singer and saxophonist as he records songs with collaborators from many nations.

results.headline: Paint It Noir
results.summary_short: “Cut to Black” has a lowlife atmosphere, as well as a broken-down private eye, a stripper in trouble and a shady boyfriend.

results.headline: It’s Not Nice to Fool the Bullied Daughter
results.summary_short: Bullied in the school gym, the telekinetic teenager again wields her power in the remake of “Carrie.”

results.headline: Action, Comedy and the Brisk Snap of Breaking Bones
results.summary_short: A suave gangster dispatches enemies while dancing and romancing in “Boss,” a film in Hindi with English subtitles.

results.summary_short: “Big Ass Spider!”: the title says it all.

results.headline: Two Boys’ Schooling, for 13 Years of It
results.summary_short: Parents document their son and one of his friends, from kindergarten through high school, in “American Promise.”

results.headline: A Gene That Doesn’t Recede
results.summary_short: “Two Jacks,” adapted from a short Tolstoy novel, is a satirical comedy about Hollywood nepotism and wheeling and dealing.

results.headline: The Agony of an Artist’s Commitment
results.summary_short: The newest life of the sculptor Camille Claudel, by the French director Bruno Dumont, picks up where the 1989 film left off.

results.headline: Hitting Pay Dirt
results.summary_short: The documentary “Symphony of the Soil” celebrates the nurturing powers of the ground beneath our feet.

results.headline: Court the Soul, Pummel the Sexuality
results.summary_short: “God Loves Uganda” explores the role of the American evangelical movement in promoting a Ugandan proposal to imprison or even execute homosexuals.
